title: Characterizing Clusters and Classifications
text:
ClusterCarac is an R package that helps you understand what makes each group in your data unique. Whether your groups come from a clustering algorithm (k-means, hierarchical clustering‚Ä¶) or from predefined categories (customer segments, regions, age groups, user types), ClusterCarac reveals the key traits that distinguish one group from another.
üîó GitHub repository:https://github.com/pcdelcampon/ClusterCarac

üß† Turn raw data into clear, interpretable group profiles
Instead of manually inspecting cross-tabs or reading long tables, ClusterCarac answers questions like:

‚ÄúWhat characterizes Group A, B and C?‚Äù
‚ÄúHow do high-churn customers differ from low-churn ones?‚Äù
‚ÄúWhat traits truly distinguish this segment?‚Äù



üåç Useful in any field where groups appear in your data

Customer and market segmentation
Social and demographic research
Public health and education projects
User and product analytics
Any dataset with categories or segments that need explanation



üß© In one sentence

ClusterCarac turns groups into stories‚Äîshowing what defines them, what sets them apart, and what truly matters.



‚≠ê Why I created ClusterCarac
ClusterCarac exists because I wanted to bring back ‚Äîin a modern, focused way‚Äî the spirit of the characterization algorithms originally implemented in FactoClass.
FactoClass, developed at the Universidad Nacional de Colombia with Professor Campo El√≠as Pardo and other collaborators, offered powerful tools for describing groups produced by clustering procedures. Over the years, many users repeatedly asked how to interpret or extract the characterization results from that package. These questions revealed something important:

People needed a clearer, more direct, and more accessible way to understand what defines each group in their data.

ClusterCarac is my response to that need.
It is not a replacement for FactoClass, but rather a retro-inspired return üïπÔ∏èüëæ‚≠ê to its core ideas ‚Äî a simplified, refined, and more user-friendly tool dedicated entirely to group characterization.

title: Bogota Road Safety Annual Reports
text:
Annual analysis of road crashes in Bogota to support public policy decisions and prioritize safer interventions. The reports bring together crash data, victims, and risk factors to produce clear, actionable narratives.

Project summary

Integrating crash datasets with geocoding by district and road type.
Year-over-year trends broken down by road user, severity, and time of day.
Heatmaps and executive tables for mobility and road safety leaders.



Methodology

Cleaning and standardizing official sources (SIOVT/BO, Traffic Police).
Trend models and interannual comparisons with confidence intervals.
Hotspot detection and intervention prioritization using reproducible rules.



Key deliverables

Annual report ready for publication with Quarto visualizations.
Interactive dashboards for monthly monitoring and quick evidence sharing.
Reproducible indicators (rate per 100k inhabitants, KSI, severity) with documentation.



Technologies
R, Quarto, Power BI/Maps, Git for version control.
